# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    # Split the string into a vector of words
    words = split(s)

    # Create a new string to store the wrapped text
    wrapped_text = ""

    # Iterate over the words and check if the current line is longer than the maximum width
    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            # If the current line is longer than the maximum width, add a new line before adding the word
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
        end

        # Add the word to the wrapped text
        wrapped_text *= word
    end

    return wrapped_text
end
```
Example:
```julia
julia> wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines", 10)
"This function\nwill wrap\nwords into\nlines"
```
